resources.string: Could exercise be making you sick? Up to half of athletes experience some form of gastrointestinal discomfort while exercising. While the severity of symptoms varies between cases, these can include nausea, vomiting, abdominal angina, and bloody diarrhoea. This is because blood flow is typically reduced during intense exercise, the Sports Medicine study revealed.

After four years in the finance industry, prioritising her work not her health, Nessa had gained weight. But she then embarked on a new healthy lifestyle, started documenting it on Instagram, and now has 358,000 followers.
Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand at arm length. Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palms of your hands until they face forward.
Stand up with your torso upright and a dumbbell on each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso.

Attach a straight or angled bar to a high pulley and grab with an overhand grip (palms facing down) at shoulder width. Standing upright with the torso straight and a very small inclination forward, bring the upper arms close to your body and perpendicular to the floor.
Lie faceup on a horizontal bench, with buttocks on the bench and feet flat on the ground.
Lie back on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand atop your thighs. The palms of your hands will be facing each other.
Lie on decline bench (between 20 ad 40 degrees). with the head angled down and feet fixe to prevent sliding and grasp the barbell with an overhand grip shoulder with.

Sit on a bench with back support in a squat rack. Position a barbell at a height that is just above your head. Once you pick up the barbell with the correct grip width, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms.

Side Lateral Raise. The dumbbell lateral raise is an isolation exercise that strengthens the entire shoulder with an emphasis on the sides of the deltoid muscles. Standing in a shoulder-width stance, grab a pair of dumbbells with palms facing inward and let them hang at your sides.
Grab a set of dumbbells and sit upright on a flat bench. Allow your arms to hang down by your sides with your palms facing towards each other.
Begin with the barbell supported on top of the traps. The chest should be up and the head facing forward.Descend by flexing the knees, refraining from moving the hips back as much as possible.
Keep your upper body straight, with your shoulders back and relaxed and chin up.
Using a leg press machine, sit down on the machine and place your legs on the platform directly in front of you at a medium (shoulder width) foot stance.
Grab the bar. Bend over without bending your legs. Bend your knees. Drop into position by bending your knees until your shins touch the bar.
Holding a barbell with a pronated grip, bend your knees slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keeping the back straight until it is almost parallel to the floor.
Begin from a dead hang, elbows straight, chest up, shoulders back and tight, eyes trained on the bar above. Pull yourself up toward the bar.
